title: Create Variables
text: We are looking to find the measure of two angles. Let $$x=measure$$ of larger angle and $$y=measure$$ of smaller angle.
speech: We are looking to find the measure of two angles. Let  x is equal to, measure  of larger angle and  y, is equal to measure  of smaller angle.

of larger angle and   y, is equal to measure

title: Translate to a System of Equations
text: The two angles are supplementary, translating into $$x+y=180$$. The larger angle is $$18$$ less than twice the measure of the smaller angle, translating into $$x=2y-18$$.
speech: The two angles are supplementary, translating into  x plus y, is equal to, 180 . The larger angle is  18  less than twice the measure of the smaller angle, translating into  x is equal to, 2 y minus 18 .
pacedSpeech: The two angles are supplementary, translating into   x plus y, is equal to, 180
less than twice the measure of the smaller angle, translating into   x is equal to, 2 y minus 18

title: Solve the System
text:
Using substitution we can substitute $$x=2y-18$$ into $$x+y=180$$ to solve for $$y$$, the smaller angle.
$$x+y=180$$
$$2y-18+y$$ $$=180$$
$$3y-18=180$$
$$3y=198$$
speech:
Using substitution we can substitute  x is equal to 2 y minus 18  into  x, plus y is equal to 180  to solve for  y , the smaller angle.
 x plus y is equal to 180 
 2, y, minus 18 plus y   is equal to, 180 
 3, y, minus 18 is equal to, 180 
 3, y is equal to 198

into   x, plus y is equal to 180
, the smaller angle.  x plus y is equal to 180

title: Finding Smaller Angle
text: What is the measure of angle $$y$$?

title: Finding Larger Angle
text: Given $$y=66$$, plug the known value into one of the equations to solve for $$x$$. What is $$x$$?
